name: The Settlers Online
description: Build a medieval kingdom in The Settlers Online!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP SP3 Processor: 2 GHz Dual Core Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Hardware Accelerated Graphics Storage: 200 MB available space Additional Notes: Permanent internet connection required
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Hardware Accelerated Graphics with 1 GB RAM Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 200 MB available space Additional Notes: Permanent internet connection required

reviews.review_text: Known this game for more then 10 years, always a joy to play.   Unfortunately the link between Steam and Settlers Online is not completely free of bugs.  After an update I wasn't able to load the game anymore and as so many players before me, I had to make the decision to leave the Steam account and think about playing in Chrome.  Not a decision someone wants to make after putting a lot of effort, patience and joy in an account.   Still, the game meets my requirements when thinking how Settlers Online would be. After a lot of years playing, this gives a significant value to the game.
It is a fun game, I think I just lost interest because I found somthing better but it definitely passes the time.
great not like other games that take forever to build stuff quicker and more survival based
Great old school game
Settlers are always welcome ;) A super family-friendly title that will bring you hours of fun!! :)

It's a great game and I've had a blast. Most of the reviews on here are scathing... 'pay to play, not free. It's like a facebook game, etc' I'm not sure what they expected from a free game. Again, I've enjoyed it.

First of all, this is not a game for those who don't have patience, a mind for VERY long term strategy or those with video game addiction issues that makes them spend real money on such games. That said, however, the game can be rewarding for those who manage to find a helpful guild that is genereous with resources and what not. Needless to say, your journey to the maximum level will not be that of a drag with a constant influx of staple building materials, weapons and food. In the end, though, if this genre, browser based strategy mmos that is, doesn't hold your attention or interest or engages you in any meaningful manner then don't try it out, period.   Despite the monsterously long building/recruiting/forging and making food queues I give this game 7.4 out of 10 relative to other games in the same genre.   P.S. The community is simply amazing, though.  Cheers!
Try it, it's free so nothing to lose.

Classic Free Settlers game, with no pay wall, and increasing deep mechanics further the level (balancing economy, expanding colonies, trading). To be noted, so far, Community seems very welcoming and mature.
Good game to kill time even though if you want the really good stuff you have to spend real money.
Just installed and uninstalled to thumb down another pay to win browser game on Steam! Woo hoo!
The Uninstallers Offline
Just an another pay2play/win game. But hey! At least it's free...

At first I was excited to see an online version of Settlers. Oh I was so wrong. Please remove this pile of cr*p from Steam. The game is very laggy, very buggy and quite far from original Settlers games. Then the level 7 bug. Final drop was the apparently 'false positive' from antivirus after suddently wanting to re-verify steam account details after being launched from Steam. Uninstalled.
Why is it on steam? It's a mobile or a browser game. And how can Ubisoft be the Publisher of this ♥♥♥♥ ?!
My history with Settlers Online: -Opens the game -Can't start a new game -Game crashes  10/10 game of the year -Gamespot

Boring, boring, boring.  This is a less shameful version of games like Dungeon Keeper Mobile: a 'free-to-wait' game. My entire time spent in the game was either waiting for a timer to finish counting down or navigating a menu. There were no clear objectives, no stakes, no intrigue, and no challenge.  XCOM: Enemy Unknown had the tutorial done and the objectives set in less than 5 minutes, even shorter if you took the option to skip the opening tutorial. Battle Nations, an example of what I consider to be a free-to-wait game actually done correctly, handed you a battle to fight it out while you built up your resources and troops to take on a looming threat, all the while the premium currency can be earned and is entirely optional for one to have.  But this game? Nothing. Just 'build buildings, stockpile resources'. If one were to take out the timers, then this game might have a chance at building up a decent pacing. As it stands, I was falling asleep and I wasn't even a half-hour into it.  The only good thing I can say about it is that during said time I wasn't badgered into spending money on premium currency. But I have a feeling that this may have changed had I trudged further in.

A completely linear gameplay of watching time counters diminish, only to get to wait for another one. The only variety is getting to wait for the tools to replenish to continue the waiting. The game is made with f**king Flash and thus everything is unresponsive as hell to click on. Also, quests frequently glitch so that a completed quest does not let you claim the quest rewards. Also, there are the usual buyable diamond in-game currency and PVP rankings just like in every Chinese style cheap cash-in game. For every penny you put into this game, shame on you. Shame. P.S. The original Settlers games are slow, repetitious and neolithic, though at least they don't practically force you to build buildings in a certain order by heavily rationing and restricting the given resources and building options from the get-go. In short, somehow this game is borderline playable despite being based on an okay game franchise. Don't waste your time with this piece of garbage.

a REALLY slow online ap game driven by you buying ubisoft gems for the most part. 1 day = 24hours in game, its ok for a quick unwind or a random 15min coffee brake but if you are looking for an RTS you can really bite into, this is not it.

Right, lets give this settlers online game a go. *you are in a queue. 1 of 1* A queue? For a browser game? You gotta be- *connected* *Plays for 5 mins* *You have lost connection to the game* I've what? *30 secs pass, game reconnects.* *plays for 5 more mins* *You have lost connection to the game*  Yea, I'm done.
Game Crashes when i click on Age

Settlers Online! For free?! Played Settlers many hours during the Amiga era. Too good to be true, and it unfortunately is. Nothing wrong with being a browser game, but the freemium premise kills the entire game for me. If you want to play the game at an acceptable pace, you will be forced to pay. Even at low levels, you need to wait for minutes until a building is complete. Don't dish out your well earned cash for this money pit, buy the old Settlers games!   Score: 3/10  Pro:  + Settlers IP + well thought of UI  Contra: - free progress is way too slow!! need to pay to speed game up to an acceptable level - bugs blocking progress

At what point in someone's life did they decide a browser-based game belongs on steam? If you want to play a browser-based game it works best with a web browser right? So what reason did this game make it to steam? Also pay-to-win garbage, refer to other reviews for evidence of being pay-to-win.
This game had taken forever to load, taking me to 3 different loading menus. This game didn't show any tutorial for how to play.
to hard to slow
Really fun until you realise you're gonna be a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ if you're not willing to invest moolah. (Playtime is misleading as I have played this A LOT in the browser version)

Do you want timers?   Because supporting games like this is how you get more timers.
quest can even be done when everthing require is done... wp wp

3 loading screens?, clunky interface, tiny stop motion graphics, tons of oppotunity's to throw more money into the game, painfully slow!, I have seen way better stuff from bluebyte and the settlers franchise. This would have been decend in the early 90s but now it is the worst in the franchise by far

I've never seen more irritating game. Don't see the point of logging in every day just to build some mines, feed fish, rebuild wells and wheatfields.. because if I don't I will lose my resources....
Unless you have a degree in computers do not buy this game they will break it with an update and expect you tyo fix it yourself.

was going to say love this game, but for the last three days i have been unable to gain access to it as it states that a plugin is not loaded, despite the fact it is loaded and working fine in everything else
